text: The 1996–97 Montreal Canadiens season was the club's 88th season. The Canadiens qualified for the playoffs despite a sub-.500 season. The Canadiens were eliminated in the Eastern Conference quarter-finals (the first round) by the New Jersey Devils 4 games to 1. ==Offseason== ==Regular season== On Wednesday, October 16, 1996, the Canadiens scored three short-handed goals in a 4-2 win over the Calgary Flames.https://www.hockey- reference.com/boxscores/199610160MTL.html The Canadiens finished the regular season 26th in both power-play goals allowed (71) and penalty-killing percentage (79.54%).https://www.hockey-reference.com/leagues/NHL_1997.html ===Final standings=== ==Schedule and results== {| class="wikitable" style="width:80%;" |- ! style="width:2%;"| # ! style="width:3%;"| R ! style="width:15%;"| Date ! style="width:5%;"| Score ! style="width:20%;"| Opponent ! style="width:10%;"| Record |- style="text-align:center;" |1||T||Oct 5, 1996||3–3 OT|| style="text-align:left;"| Ottawa Senators||0–0–1 |- style="text-align:center;" |2||T||Oct 7, 1996||6–6 OT|| style="text- align:left;"| Mighty Ducks of Anaheim||0–0–2 |- style="text-align:center;
